oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Vorlag Effekte einer Schwefel- und Phosphor-Düngung auf Futterleguminosen auf einem Schwefel- und Phosphormangelstandort
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Fischinger, Stephanie A.
Becker, Konstantin
Riffel, Alexandra
Leithold, Günter
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Cereals, pulses and oilseeds
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this study the effect of sulphate fertilization and rock phosphate fertilization on legumes in a grass clover mixture was investigated on a field under S and P limiting conditions. The results showed that S fertilization resulted in higher yield. Increment of yield came along with higher P uptake, but with decline in P concentration in the shoots. The results suggest that although P might have become a limiting factor, the plants have realized to meet their increased P demand in the case of higher growth rates. became a limiting factor. Independent of S fertilization level rock phosphate application didn’t show any effect.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Fischinger, Stephanie A.; Becker, Konstantin; Riffel, Alexandra and Leithold, Günter (2013) Vorlag Effekte einer Schwefel- und Phosphor-Düngung auf Futterleguminosen auf einem Schwefel- und Phosphormangelstandort. Paper at: 12. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Rheinische Friedrich-Wilhelms-Universität, Bonn, 5. bis 8. März 2013.
